Articles.Content:
Just wondering who plays.

It's a RTS 3d space sim for iOS.

Kudos for Fishlabs for actually trying to make a good game and not being like other stereotypical developers.

If you want, I'll gladly form an alliance for KSP players or something (Lvl 25).

EDIT: GOFA is for both iOS and around 75% of the Andriod Population

EDIT2: Join the Kerbal Alliance!

EDIT3: The Kerbal Alliance is at all-out war! We need as much KSP players to turn the tide, as our very existance is at stake!.

Edited March 2, 2014 by NASAFanboy

I thought there was only galaxy on fire one and two,

I like the second one a lot, was playing it this morning as a matter of fact, trying to get every single ship possible

Was this third one released recently? Cause I've searched the AppStore before and never saw it.

I thought there was only galaxy on fire one and two,

I like the second one a lot, was playing it this morning as a matter of fact, trying to get every single ship possible

Was this third one released recently? Cause I've searched the AppStore before and never saw it.

This one is a RTS MMO game. Its probably the closest we'll ever get to Eve on iOS.

The overall atmosphere of the game is good. The galaxies and solar systems aren't that crowded (And the system you start in is completely yours, and enemies can't find it), you can't buy resources or ships with credits (Thus, much less P2W), and the graphics are amazing.

I highly recommend it.

Anyways, hanging out in my home system with a massive fleet, might start a lighting war against my neighboring systems.
I'll try it, I really like the other galaxy on fire games.

This one is a RTS MMO game. Its probably the closest we'll ever get to Eve on iOS.

The overall atmosphere of the game is good. The galaxies and solar systems aren't that crowded (And the system you start in is completely yours, and enemies can't find it), you can't buy resources or ships with credits (Thus, much less P2W), and the graphics are amazing.

I highly recommend it.

Anyways, hanging out in my home system with a massive fleet, might start a lighting war against my neighboring systems.

A what game?

Can you explain what all these RTS and MMO things mean?

Hurm, I played Galaxy on Fire 2 HD on my iPhone 4 which was barely able to run it, but by heaven it looked glorious, and it was a pretty great game overall. Controls could have used work. I'll try out GoF RTS some time!

A what game?

Can you explain what all these RTS and MMO things mean?

real time strategy(total war series, age a empires) and Massively multiplayer online game(wow)

@OP I didn't know they had an RTS version. played the second one and loved it I will probably grab it from the app story when I get home
Does it exist for android? If so, I'm up (Apple is rather evil)
apple's not evil

Does it exist for android? If so, I'm up (Apple is rather evil)

It does exist for Andriod. I see Nexus and Galaxy S3 users in the forums quite often. So either that, or the S3 and Nexus now runs iOS.

Anyways, I'm making a alliance for KSP players (Level 30 now with a couple hundred ships, Woohoo!)

What should I name it?

KSPA

kerbal space program alliance

KSPA

kerbal space program alliance

Made a alliance called the "Kerbal Alliance"

Let's get planet-conquering!
I applied. I'm "TechyKerbal", can ou add me?
it's not really an rts..
It says I need to "upgrade my iOS to 6" something,

It says I need to "upgrade my iOS to 6" something,

FYI their on 7.2 by now.
7.3 I think acually
I just downloaded the game. Do all members of an alliance need to be of the same species? Or can I join regardless of which race I choose?
Any race you chose.

Started Operation Kerbal Fury for my alliance.

If it goes well, my alliance will become a major regional power, due to the fact that we have captured a Citadel planet (Which is rare, and produces artifacts).

If it doesn't go well, it'll end in a bloody war and we will still come out on top as a major regional power, as I own more planets (Which are much better defended) with a higher level than everyone in that alliance combined. It'll mostly be a quick fight, that is, if they ever show up for a fight (The defenders are extreme inactive. I've watched them for four days and have seen no movement).

Oddly enough, the entire planetary system is rated as extremely valuable, and even with its Citadel Planet (Which usually are instantly monopolized by high-level players), the only defending in the entire system are around a motley fleet of 50 fighters, interceptors, and bombers (Which I quickly took care of with a force of four carriers and 250 spacecraft) and no troops in the whole system (In comparsion, my invasion fleet has 500 soldiers, which is about 1/4th of my manpower). Which is strange, considering that the system has extreme military value.

Anyways, the next few days will be tedious as I quickly occupy their entire system as fast as possible in a blitzkrieg stragety.
No android version?

No android version?

There is, but its only compatible with about 75% of the population.

I often see Andriod players on the GOFA forums, and I've seen it in Google Play.

Anyways, its one more minute until the Kerbal Alliance recieves it first Citadel Planet (In a completely hostile solar system).

Trying to defend it is going to be a hellish job...

EDIT: I've captured the enemy Citadel and almost their entire resource base. A attack on their main planet finished off the rest of their fleet. The planet is ours!

Edited February 28, 2014 by NASAFanboy

And now, the enemy is attacking us repeatedly, and we're locked in combat with another alliance.

We need recruits! We cannot lose Anof3!

I tried searching for the game on the play store, but the "Alliances" part is missing. The nearest one is "Galaxy On Fire 2".

I'd join if my iPod could run it without ctd everytime I try to run it. :/
I sent over everything I can
